page.title: 09Francis Pettit Smith
page.content:
In Hythe a man was born whose name was{Francis Pettit Smith.}His house was in Hythe High Street. He invented the British version of the marine screw propeller.
He took part in a new form of nautical spectacular; the tug of war. In 1845,{H.M.S Rattler,}the first Royal Naval screw propelled ship, was at one end of the rope while at the other end was the paddle wheeler {"Alecto".
The two ships stood stern to stern. When a signal was given they both went full speed ahead. Both the ships had 200 hp engines. H.M.S Rattler's stern propulsion was stronger and pulled the Alecto at 2.5 knots at full speed.
